oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crayon print of Pvt. Thomas Burchfield and Pvt. John G. Burchfield
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Crayon print of Pvt. Thomas Burchfield and Pvt. John G. Burchfield, of Co. B, 13th Cav. Regt., USA. Family reports that they were bridge burners in the secret service under Col. John K. Miller. Other sources list Co. G for John G. Burchfield. They wore 1855 pattern cavalry uniforms, with a variant stripe outside the buttons, and posed with revolvers and cavalry sabers (1840s or 1860s). John enlisted at 15, became a corporal and requested a return to the rank of private.
